question: What is the purpose of the console.log() function in JavaScript?
answer2: To log messages to the console
answer3: To prompt the user for input
rightAnswer: To log messages to the console

question: Which of the following is a valid way to declare a variable in JavaScript?
What is the difference between null and undefined in JavaScript?
answer1: null is a value that represents the absence of any object value, while undefined is a variable that has not been declared or assigned a value
answer2: null is a variable that has not been declared, while undefined is a value that represents the absence of any object value
answer3: null and undefined are the same thing
answer4: null is a string value, while undefined is a number value
rightAnswer: null is a value that represents the absence of any object value, while undefined is a variable that has not been declared or assigned a value

question: Which of the following is an example of a JavaScript event?
What is the purpose of the addEventListener() method in JavaScript?
answer1: To remove an event listener from an element
answer2: To add an event listener to an element
answer3: To trigger an event on an element
answer4: To cancel an event on an element
rightAnswer: To add an event listener to an element

What is the purpose of the JSON.parse() method in JavaScript?
answer1: To convert a JavaScript object to a JSON string
answer2: To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object
rightAnswer: To convert a JSON string to a JavaScript object
